intro: Euploca cunninghamii, commonly known as the white-flowered flax lily, is a perennial herb native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swampy areas. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Euploca cunninghamii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
